place.name: BARFORD
place.gazetteerText: BARFORD, a parish in Forehoe district, Norfolk; on the river Yare, 5 miles NNW of Wymondham r. station, and 9 W of Norwich. Post Town, Barnham-Broom under Wymondham. Acres, 1,052. Real property, £22,506. Pop., 419. Houses, 94. The property is sub-divided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £288. Patron, Skinner Turner, Esq. The church is good; and there are two Methodist chapels. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
